sinks.name: TEE_AllocateOperation
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on operation type could lead to improper allocation or memory corruption.

sinks.name: TEE_AllocateOperation
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on size/length parameters could lead to buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: TEE_AllocateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Missing input validation for object type

sinks.name: TEE_AllocateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Missing input validation for maximum key size

sinks.name: TEE_CheckMemoryAccessRights
sinks.reason: Tainted buffer address could lead to improper access rights checks.

sinks.name: TEE_CheckMemoryAccessRights
sinks.reason: Tainted size parameter could lead to buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: TEE_CipherInit
sinks.reason: Tainted IV could lead to improper initialization of the cipher operation, potentially causing security issues in subsequent operations.

sinks.name: TEE_CipherInit
sinks.reason: Tainted IV length could lead to buffer overflows or memory corruption issues.

sinks.name: TEE_Free
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on the pointer, which could lead to undefined behavior if tainted data is passed.

sinks.name: TEE_Malloc
sinks.reason: Size parameter can be manipulated to cause buffer overflows or excessive memory allocation.

sinks.name: TEE_PopulateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on attrs pointer could lead to buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: TEE_SetOperationKey
sinks.reason: Potential for using a corrupt or invalid key object handle

sinks.name: TEE_SetOperationKey
sinks.reason: Potential for using an invalid operation handle

sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated to cause buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Pointer could point to shared memory, leading to unencrypted output to Normal World.
